Files | Macros | Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions
SBL TDA2xx Lib

Files

file  sbl_lib_tda2xx.h
 This file contains the interfaces present in the Secondary Bootloader(SBL) Library valid for TDA2xx SOC family (TDA2xx and TDA2Ex platform). This also contains some related macros, structures and enums.
 

Macros

#define SBLLIB_SOC_L3_IPU2_RAM_BASE   ((uint32_t) 0x55020000U)
 This macro contains the IPU2's internal RAM base address as accessed from L3's(SOC) view.
 
#define SBLLIB_MAX_MPU_CORES   ((uint32_t) 2U)
 This macro contains the maximum number of MPU cores where each dual core MPU subsystem is counted as two cores.
 
#define SBLLIB_MAX_IPU_CORES   ((uint32_t) 4U)
 This macro contains the maximum number of M4 cores in the system.
 
#define SBLLIB_MAX_DSP_CORES   ((uint32_t) 2U)
 This macro contains the maximum number of DSP cores.
 
#define SBLLIB_MAX_EVE_CORES   ((uint32_t) 4U)
 This macro contains the maximum number of EVE cores.
 
#define SBLLIB_DUAL_EMIF_2X512MB   (0U)
 
#define SBLLIB_DUAL_EMIF_1GB_512MB   (1U)
 
#define SBLLIB_SINGLE_EMIF_256MB   (2U)
 
#define SBLLIB_SINGLE_EMIF_512MB   (3U)
 

Typedefs

typedef enum sbllibCoreId sbllibCoreId_t
 Enum to select the Core Id. Each dual core CPU is considered as two separate cores to get number of individual cores. Dual core CPU is added as one core in the end.
 

Enumerations

enum  sbllibCoreId {
  SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU_CPU0, SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU_CPU1, SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1_CPU0, SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1_CPU1,

int32_t SBLLibHSConfigureOcmc1Firewall (uint32_t regionId, uint32_t startAddress, uint32_t size, uint32_t domainAndAccessPerm, uint32_t initiatorPerm)
 This function configures the specified region of OCMC1 firewall as specified by the arguments using PPA service on TDA2x HS devices. PPA service will enforce blocking of all accesses to first 4kB of OCMC1 as required due to silicon erratum. To ensure this, it also prevents use of regionId 0 and 1. For GP devices and on cores other than A15 on HS devices, it will not do anything. More...

Macro Definition Documentation

#define SBLLIB_DUAL_EMIF_1GB_512MB   (1U)

Emif mode is DUAL_EMIF_1GB_512MB

#define SBLLIB_DUAL_EMIF_2X512MB   (0U)

Emif mode is DUAL_EMIF_2X512MB

#define SBLLIB_SINGLE_EMIF_256MB   (2U)

Emif mode is SINGLE_EMIF_256MB

#define SBLLIB_SINGLE_EMIF_512MB   (3U)

Emif mode is SINGLE_EMIF_512MB

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum sbllibCoreId

Enum to select the Core Id. Each dual core CPU is considered as two separate cores to get number of individual cores. Dual core CPU is added as one core in the end.

Enumerator
SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU_CPU0 

Core: Cortex A15 CPU0

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU_CPU1 

Core: Cortex A15 CPU1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1_CPU0 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU1) CPU0

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1_CPU1 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU1) CPU1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1 

Core: Dual Cortex M4 (IPU1)

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU2_CPU0 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU2) CPU0

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU2_CPU1 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU2) CPU1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU2 

Core: Dual Cortex M4 (IPU2)

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_DSP1 

Core: C66x DSP1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_DSP2 

Core: C66x DSP2

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE1 

Core: EVE1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE2 

Core: EVE2

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE3 

Core: EVE3

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE4 

Core: EVE4

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU 

Core: Dual Cortex A15

SBLLIB_CORE_MAX 

Enum value for maximum number of cores

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU_CPU0 

Core: Cortex A15 CPU0

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU_CPU1 

Core: Cortex A15 CPU1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1_CPU0 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU1) CPU0

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1_CPU1 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU1) CPU1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU2_CPU0 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU2) CPU0

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU2_CPU1 

Core: Cortex M4 (IPU2) CPU1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_DSP1 

Core: C66x DSP1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_DSP2 

Core: C66x DSP2

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE1 

Core: EVE1

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE2 

Core: EVE2

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE3 

Core: EVE3

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_EVE4 

Core: EVE4

SBLLIB_CORE_INDIVIDUAL_MAX 

Enum value for maximum number individual cores

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_MPU 

Core: Dual Cortex A15

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1 

Core: Dual Cortex M4 (IPU1)

SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU2 

Core: Dual Cortex M4 (IPU2)

void SBLLibEVE2BringUp ( uint32_t  entryPoint,
uint32_t  sblBuildMode 
)

This function sets the entry point and releases the EVE2 from reset.

Parameters
entryPointEVE2 entry location on reset.
sblBuildModeSBL's Build Mode. Refer enum sbllibSblBuildMode_t for values.
Returns
None.

int32_t SBLLibHSAuthenticateBinary ( uint32_t  address,
uint32_t  size 
)

This function authenticates a binary image defined by the arguments using a ROM HAL service on TDA2x HS devices. For GP devices and on cores other than A15 on HS devices, it will not do anything.

Parameters
addressLocation of data blob to be authenticated
sizeSize of data blob to be authenticated. Size includes data size and authentication signature size.
Returns
status STW_SOK : Image has a valid signature STW_EFAIL : Image has a in-valid signature Always STW_SOK on GP devices/non-A15 cores on HS devices
int32_t SBLLibHSConfigureOcmc1Firewall ( uint32_t  regionId,
uint32_t  startAddress,
uint32_t  size,
uint32_t  domainAndAccessPerm,
uint32_t  initiatorPerm 
)

This function configures the specified region of OCMC1 firewall as specified by the arguments using PPA service on TDA2x HS devices. PPA service will enforce blocking of all accesses to first 4kB of OCMC1 as required due to silicon erratum. To ensure this, it also prevents use of regionId 0 and 1. For GP devices and on cores other than A15 on HS devices, it will not do anything.

Parameters
regionIdRegion ID to be used in the firewall
startAddress4kB aligned start address for the region to be firewalled
sizeSize of region to be firewalled. Must be a multiple of 4kB
domainAndAccessPermValue to be configured in MRM_PERMISSION_REGION_LOW_j where j == regionId
initiatorPermValue to be configured in MRM_PERMISSION_REGION_HIGH_j where j == regionId
Returns
status Whether configuration was success STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure Always STW_SOK on GP devices/non-A15 cores on HS devices
void SBLLibHSOpenL3Firewalls ( void  )

This function opens up EMIF/MA_MPU/OCMC2/OCMC3 firewalls using PPA service on TDA2x HS devices. For GP devices and on cores other than A15 on HS devices, it will not do anything.

Returns
None.

int32_t SBLLibIPU1SubsystemReset ( void  )

This function first asserts the both CPU and sub-system resets of the IPU1 sub-system and de-asserts the sub-system reset.

Returns
status Whether IPU1 sub-system reset is done correctly STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure

void SBLLibIPUBringUp ( uint32_t  ipuId,
uint32_t  entryPointCPU0,
uint32_t  entryPointCPU1,
uint32_t  sblBuildMode 
)

This function sets the entry point and releases both cores of IPU1 from reset.

Parameters
ipuIdIPU's Id SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU1 : IPU1 SBLLIB_CORE_ID_IPU2 : IPU2
entryPointCPU0CPU0's entry location on reset.
entryPointCPU1CPU1's entry location on reset.
sblBuildModeSBL's Build Mode. Refer enum sbllibSblBuildMode_t for values.
Returns
None.
